abstract: Pres Obama asks Congress to let Medicare officials negotiate prices with drug manufacturers in effort to lower sky-high prices for genetically-tailored specialty medications.
lead_paragraph: Efforts to create precision medicines that use genetic information to aid treatment can cost well over $50,000 and as high as $311,000, raising issues for users and the Medicare system.

headline.main: Obama Proposes That Medicare Be Given the Right to Negotiate the Cost of Drugs
headline.print_headline: Obama Proposes That Medicare Be Given the Right to Negotiate the Cost of Drugs

snippet: Efforts to create precision medicines that use genetic information to aid treatment can cost well over $50,000 and as high as $311,000, raising issues for users and the Medicare system.
